One synthetic maize variety with improved high-temperature tolerance to grain formation was expressed in the APSIM model. The high-temperature stress function introduced in the model to describe the response of grain-number to temperature is [ 27]:

Grain-number fertility percentage ( δ) reduced when the daily maximum temperature ( T
max , °C) exceeded a threshold temperature ( T
lim , °C) around anthesis. For the variety Xundan29, T
lim had a value of 36°C. To simulate the possible effect of an increase in tolerance of grain number to high temperatures, we assumed that this response would be shifted, increasing the value of T
lim to 37°C.
